questions.text: I’d rather be accurate than impressive.
I feel responsible for protecting what matters, even if it costs me.
I naturally keep track of details others overlook.
I can translate conflict into something people can actually talk about.
If I can’t control the outcome, I struggle to relax.
I give so much that I secretly feel unseen.
When I feel judged, I reject the whole system first.
I carefully curate how I’m perceived so I won’t be dismissed.
I’d rather build something real than talk about building it.
I notice symbolism and hidden meaning in everyday life.
I sense what’s coming before I can explain why.
I document things so the truth won’t get lost.
I assume something will go wrong, so I stay prepared.
I prefer to keep my feelings private so they can’t be used against me.
I adapt to what others want until I forget what I want.
